info.author: Romain Warlop
info.description:
# ALS-WR : Alternating-Least-Squares with Weighted-Œª-Regularization 

This is the code to perform ALS-WR as presented by [Zhou et al] 

The code is mainly inspired from [Mendeley Ltd]

-   *R*‚ÄÑ‚àà‚ÄÑ‚Ñù<sup>*n*‚ÄÖ√ó‚ÄÖ*p*</sup>‚ÄÑ=‚ÄÑ(*r*<sub>*i**j*</sub>) denote the sparse user-item matrix.
-   ùíü is the set of available ratings.
-   Assume a low rank constraint *K* on the matrix : *R*‚ÄÑ=‚ÄÑ*U**V*<sup>*T*</sup>, *U*,‚ÄÜ*V*‚ÄÑ‚àà‚ÄÑ‚Ñù<sup>*n*‚ÄÖ√ó‚ÄÖ*K*</sup>,‚ÄÜ‚Ñù<sup>*p*‚ÄÖ√ó‚ÄÖ*K*</sup>
-   *U*<sub>*i*</sub> and *V*<sub>*j*</sub> denotes respectively the latent features of user *i* and item *j*.
-   *n*<sub>*u*<sub>*i*</sub></sub> is the number of ratings provided by user *i*.
-   *n*<sub>*v*<sub>*j*</sub></sub> is the number of ratings available for item *j*.
-   *J*<sub>*i*</sub> and *L*<sub>*j*</sub> is respectively the set of rated item by user *i* and available ratings for item *j*.

Objective function :
*f*(*U*,‚ÄÜ*V*)=‚àë<sub>*i*,‚ÄÜ*j*‚ÄÑ‚àà‚ÄÑùíü</sub>(*r*<sub>*i**j*</sub>‚ÄÖ‚àí‚ÄÖ*U*<sub>*i*</sub>*V*<sub>*j*</sub><sup>*T*</sup>)<sup>2</sup>‚ÄÖ+‚ÄÖ*Œª*(‚àë<sub>*i*</sub>*n*<sub>*u*<sub>*i*</sub></sub>||*U*<sub>*i*</sub>||<sup>2</sup>+‚àë<sub>*i*</sub>*n*<sub>*v*<sub>*j*</sub></sub>||*V*<sub>*j*</sub>||<sup>2</sup>)

 **Algorithm**

-   Input : *R*, *K* (possibly an initialization of *U* or *V* with SVD)
-   Until convergence do
    -   For each user (in parallel if wanted)
        -   *U*<sub>*i*</sub>‚ÄÑ=‚ÄÑ(*V*<sub>*I*<sub>*i*</sub></sub>*V*<sub>*I*<sub>*i*</sub></sub>‚ÄÖ+‚ÄÖ*Œª**I*<sub>*K*</sub>)<sup>‚àí1</sup>*V*<sub>*I*<sub>*i*</sub></sub>*R*<sub>*i*,‚ÄÜ*I*<sub>*i*</sub></sub>
    -   For each item (in parallel if wanted)
        -   *V*<sub>*j*</sub>‚ÄÑ=‚ÄÑ(*U*<sub>*L*<sub>*j*</sub></sub>*U*<sub>*L*<sub>*j*</sub></sub>‚ÄÖ+‚ÄÖ*Œª**I*<sub>*K*</sub>)<sup>‚àí1</sup>*U*<sub>*L*<sub>*j*</sub></sub>*R*<sub>*L*<sub>*j*</sub>,‚ÄÜ*j*</sub>

  [Zhou et al]: http://www.grappa.univ-lille3.fr/~mary/cours/stats/centrale/reco/paper/MatrixFactorizationALS.pdf
  [Mendeley Ltd]: https://github.com/Mendeley/mrec/blob/master/mrec/mf/wrmf.py
info.name: pyalswr
